name: Drawing marbles from an urn - Part 3
description: ### Given Given two urns `urn1` and `urn2`, **two** marbles are drawn from **each** urn **without replacement** into a third urn `urn3`. From that urn, now containing **four** marbles, again **two** marbles are drawn **without replacement**. We know that **at least one** of those two marbles has color `color`. ## Task Return the **exact probability** as a ratio of the **other** marble having the **same** color. --- ### Input - `urn1`: an object depicting an urn where each key is a color (string), and each value the number of marbles of that color (integer) - `urn2`: an object depicting an urn where each key is a color (string), and each value the number of marbles of that color (integer) - `color`: the color of at least one of two marbles drawn from `urn3` (string) after two marbles were drawn from respectively `urn1` and `urn2` into `urn3` ### Output - return the exact probability as ratio of the other marble having the same color `color` (array with 2 elements; the numerator (big integer) and denominator (big integer)) ### Constraints - the ratio needs to be in compact form: `[2, 4]` should be `[1, 2]` - `urn1` and `urn2` contain at least 2 marbles - the amount of marbles in both urns are reported **before** marbles are drawn and put into the third urn - the color is always available as key in both urns - at least one of both urns has at least one marble of the given color - the amount of marbles by color is a non-negative integer --- ### Kata Series - Drawing marbles from an urn - Part 1 - Drawing marbles from an urn - Part 2 - Drawing marbles from an urn - Part 3 (this kata) --- Good luck, have fun!
